summary: Ghosts are believed to be the spirits of the deceased, appearing to the living in various forms, from invisible to lifelike. The Hammersmith Ghost, an 1804 engraving, turned out to be a cobbler's prank. While ghost beliefs are widespread, dating back to ancient cultures, science offers no proof of their existence. Ghost hunting is considered pseudoscience. Some ghost sightings may be linked to brain diseases or medication side effects. In folklore, ghosts are categorized under E200â€“E599 in the motif index.
